item.description:
NOTE: This plan is very tentative. It depends on work, family commitments, and if others are interested.

Last Friday the trail was unbroken, 12 inches of powder at 3600 ft, so I turned around short of the summit. Unless we get new snow, it's packed out beautifully now...

 

Note: I'm a fairly slow hiker on ascents, so if you want to rocket up the hill, we're probably not a good match.


Hike Description: Starting from the end of Little River Rd, take the "winter route" to the North Twin trail summer trailhead on Haystack Rd. Use the popular bushwack around the 1st 2 water crossings. Follow the North Twin Trail over the 3rd water crossing to the  summit of North Twin. Continue to South Twin on the North Twin spur, and return by the same path.  Distance from the "summer trailhead" is 11.2 miles/3700 ft elevation gain. The old trail from Little River Rd adds about 1 mile each way.

Difficulty/hike rating:  moderate to strenuous

Mileage: about 13 miles

Elevation gain: about 3700

Estimated RT: 10+ hours. If conditions require dropping South Twin, that takes about 2.5 mi/2:50 off this.

Meetup time: 7:30AM/boots on trail before 8

The goal is to start together as a group, hike together and finish together as a group.Expect that we will be walking out in the dark (this is a long hike). Proper winter "Hikesafe" clothing and gear required. Know your equipment and how to pack your gear, review the weather conditions before you arrive.

I serve only as social coordinator for this event. I am not a guide, outfitter, or leader. Even though we will hike as a group, you are fundamentally responsible for your own planning, gear, food, water, provisioning, and safety. As with any winter hike, conditions can be highly variable and changeable, and you should be prepared both to be out after dark, and possibly to spend the night. Since this is an out-and-back, we will always have the option of turning around if progress is too slow.

NOAA Snow Depth Map

ALL CANCELLATIONS OR CHANGES TO RSVP'S SHOULD BE MADE BY 6 PM THE NIGHT BEFORE THE HIKE. We rely of the RSVP's to get a true headcount and the hikers rely on the leaders to communicate.
item.how_to_find_us: At the parking area at the end of Little River Rd.
item.name: North/South Twin via Little River Rd
